intro: Kickxia aegyptiaca subsp. aegyptiaca, commonly known as the Egyptian spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Boraginaceae. It is characterized by its hairy, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, blue to purple flowers arranged in a loose cluster, typically blooming in the summer months. It is native to regions of the Mediterranean and parts of Asia, often found in dry, rocky habitats. Due to its ornamental value and adaptability, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
